channel.title: Comments on: BI Interview Questions….

item.title: By: Emil

item.content:encoded:
Good questions

Below is link to some more BI Questions starting from basic SQL and finishing on SSRS and SSIS (ETL)

Regards
Emil

item.title: By: Ted Krueger (onpnt)
item.dc:creator: Ted Krueger (onpnt)
item.content:encoded:
The funny thing is, the line of questioning on Indexing is kind of subjective and I’d probably have a field day with them on it.

e.g.
Are clustered index scans beneficial to an execution plan?

and then ask
Are there any performance issues with having a lot of indexes on a table?

First, you can’t answer the first question on if it is beneficial or not unless you have a description of a lot of variables to the equation. The second is a common question but again, depends on how it is being asked.

After writing a few tests for companies that provide interview questions, I’ve realized how important it is to be critical of the details when asking them. It was one reason I liked the company I moved to. They asked the questions the right way when “I” interviewed them. ðŸ™‚ cause remember, the interview process is you interviewing them as much as the other way around.

That’s the second time I’ve seen surrogate key recently. Is it something hard to define for some people? Just curious.

item.title: By: Kim Tessereau
item.dc:creator: Kim Tessereau
item.description: I didn't get into the storage options for the cube, I was just looking for someone to do the ETL portion of the process. I liked your SQL Server Quiz!
item.content:encoded: I didn’t get into the storage options for the cube, I was just looking for someone to do the ETL portion of the process. I liked your SQL Server Quiz!

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.content:encoded:
To me the interviewing process is very frustrating, I always wonder about if I am looking at the correct resume because the person on the phone doesn’t match the resume at all

I am surprised you didn’t ask for the difference between ROLAP, MOLAP and HOLAP

I also did a post with some SQL questions a while back, you can find it here: SQL Server Quiz, Can You Answer All These?
